infodynamics.measures.continuous.gaussian

Class ConditionalMutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariateGaussian

  • java.lang.Object
    • infodynamics.measures.continuous.ConditionalMutualInfoMultiVariateCommon
      • infodynamics.measures.continuous.gaussian.ConditionalMutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariateGaussian
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ConditionalMutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariate, InfoMeasureCalculatorContinuous, AnalyticNullDistributionComputer, EmpiricalNullDistributionComputer, java.lang.Cloneable

    public class ConditionalMutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariateGaussian
extends ConditionalMutualInfoMultiVariateCommon
implements ConditionalMutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariate, AnalyticNullDistributionComputer, java.lang.Cloneable

    Computes the differential conditional mutual information of two multivariate double[][] sets of observations, conditioned on another (implementing ConditionalMutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariate), assuming that the probability distribution function for these observations is a multivariate Gaussian distribution. This is achieved by extending the common code base in ConditionalMutualInfoMultiVariateCommon.

    Usage is as per the paradigm outlined for ConditionalMutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariate, with:

    • The constructor step being a simple call to ConditionalMutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariateGaussian().
    • The property ConditionalMutualInfoMultiVariateCommon.PROP_NORMALISE is set to false by default here (since this makes more sense for linear-Gaussian analysis), which is different to the parent class.
    • The user can call setCovariance(double[][], boolean) or setCovariance(double[][], int) or setCovarianceAndMeans(double[][], double[], int) instead of supplying observations via ConditionalMutualInfoMultiVariateCommon.setObservations(double[][], double[][], double[][]) or ConditionalMutualInfoMultiVariateCommon.addObservations(double[][], double[][], double[][]) etc.
    • Computed values are in nats, not bits!
    • Additional method computeSignificance() to compute null distribution analytically.

    References:

    • T. M. Cover and J. A. Thomas, 'Elements of Information Theory' (John Wiley & Sons, New York, 1991).
    Author:
    Joseph Lizier (email, www)
    See Also:
    Differential entropy for Gaussian random variables at Mathworld, Differential entropy for Gaussian random variables at Wikipedia, Multivariate normal distribution on Wikipedia

      • PROP_BIAS_CORRECTION

        Constant Field Values

      • biasCorrection

        protected boolean biasCorrection
        Whether to analytically bias correct the returned values

      • L

        protected double[][] L
        Cached Cholesky decomposition of the covariance matrix of the most recently supplied observations. Is a matrix [C_11, C_12, C_1c; C_21, C_22, C_2c; C_c1, C_c2, C_cc], where C_xy represents the covariance matrix of variable x to variable y where x,y are either variable 1, 2 or the conditional. The covariance matrix is symmetric, and should be positive definite (otherwise we have linealy dependent variables).

      • L_1c

        protected double[][] L_1c
        Cached Cholesky decomposition of the (var1, conditional) covariance matrix

      • L_2c

        protected double[][] L_2c
        Cached Cholesky decomposition of the (var2, conditional) covariance matrix

      • L_cc

        protected double[][] L_cc
        Cached Cholesky decomposition of the conditional covariance matrix

      • means

        protected double[] means
        Means of the most recently supplied observations (source variables listed first, destination variables second).

      • detCovariance

        protected double detCovariance
        Cached determinants of the joint covariance matrix

      • setProperty

        public void setProperty(java.lang.String propertyName,
               java.lang.String propertyValue)
        Sets properties for the Gaussian CMI calculator. New property values are not guaranteed to take effect until the next call to an initialise method.

        Valid property names, and what their values should represent, include:

        • PROP_BIAS_CORRECTION -- if set to "true", then the analytically determined bias (as the mean of the surrogate distribution) will be subtracted from all calculated values. Default is "false".
        • any valid properties for ConditionalMutualInfoMultiVariateCommon.setProperty(String, String), except for ConditionalMutualInfoMultiVariateCommon.PROP_NORMALISE which is simply ignored here (the value would not change the functionality in any case)

        Unknown property values are ignored.

        Specified by:
        setProperty in interface InfoMeasureCalculatorContinuous
        Overrides:
        setProperty in class ConditionalMutualInfoMultiVariateCommon
        Parameters:
        propertyName - name of the property
        propertyValue - value of the property
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - for invalid property values

        public void finaliseAddObservations()
                             throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from class: ConditionalMutualInfoMultiVariateCommon
        Signal that the observations are now all added, PDFs can now be constructed. This default implementation simply puts all of the observations into the ConditionalMutualInfoMultiVariateCommon.var1Observations, ConditionalMutualInfoMultiVariateCommon.var2Observations and ConditionalMutualInfoMultiVariateCommon.condObservations arrays. Usually child implementations will override this, call this implementation to perform the common processing, then perform their own processing.

      • setCovariance

        public void setCovariance(double[][] covariance,
                 int numObservations)
                   throws java.lang.Exception

        Set the covariance of the distribution for which we will compute the conditional mutual information.

        Note that without setting any observations, you cannot later call computeLocalOfPreviousObservations(), and without providing the means of the variables, you cannot later call computeLocalUsingPreviousObservations(double[][], double[][], double[][]).

        Parameters:
        covariance - covariance matrix of var1, var2, conditional variables, considered jointly together.
        numObservations - the number of observations that the covariance was determined from. This is used for later significance calculations
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - for covariance matrix not matching the expected dimensions, being non-square, asymmetric or non-positive definite

      • setCovariance

        protected void setCovariance(double[][] covariance,
                 boolean determinedFromObservations)
                      throws java.lang.Exception

        Set the covariance of the distribution for which we will compute the conditional mutual information.

        Note that without setting any observations, you cannot later call computeLocalOfPreviousObservations(), and without providing the means of the variables, you cannot later call computeLocalUsingPreviousObservations(double[][], double[][], double[][]).

        Parameters:
        covariance - covariance matrix of var1, var2 and the conditional variables, considered jointly together.
        determinedFromObservations - whether the covariance matrix was determined internally from observations or not
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - for covariance matrix not matching the expected dimensions, being non-square, asymmetric or non-positive definite

      • setCovarianceAndMeans

        public void setCovarianceAndMeans(double[][] covariance,
                         double[] means,
                         int numObservations)
                           throws java.lang.Exception

        Set the covariance of the distribution for which we will compute the mutual information, as well as the means for each variable.

        Note that without setting any observations, you cannot later call computeLocalOfPreviousObservations() (but you can call computeLocalUsingPreviousObservations(double[][], double[][], double[][])).

        Parameters:
        covariance - covariance matrix of var1, var2 and conditional variables, considered jointly together.
        means - mean of var1, var2 and conditional variables (as per covariance)
        numObservations - the number of observations that the mean and covariance were determined from. This is used for later significance calculations
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • computeAverageLocalOfObservations

        public double computeAverageLocalOfObservations()
                                         throws java.lang.Exception

        Computes the local values of the conditional mutual information, for each valid observation in the previously supplied observations (with PDFs computed using all of the previously supplied observation sets).

        The joint differential entropy for a multivariate Gaussian-distribution of dimension n with covariance matrix C is -0.5*\log_e{(2*pi*e)^n*|det(C)|}, where det() is the matrix determinant of C.

        Here we compute the conditional mutual information from the joint entropies of all variables (H_12c), variable 1 and conditional (H_1c), variable 2 and conditional (H_2c) and conditional (H_c), giving MI = H_1c + H_2c - H_c - H_12c. We assume that the recorded estimation of the covariance is correct (i.e. we will not make a bias correction for limited observations here).

        Specified by:
        computeAverageLocalOfObservations in interface InfoMeasureCalculatorContinuous
        Returns:
        the conditional mutual information of the previously provided observations or from the supplied covariance matrix, in nats (not bits!). Returns NaN if any of the determinants are zero (because this will make the denominator of the log zero)
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • computeLocalOfPreviousObservations

        public double[] computeLocalOfPreviousObservations()
                                            throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from interface: ConditionalMutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariate

        Computes the local values of the conditional mutual information, for each valid observation in the previously supplied observations (with PDFs computed using all of the previously supplied observation sets).

        If the samples were supplied via a single call such as ConditionalMutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariate.setObservations(double[][], double[][], double[][]), then the return value is a single time-series of local channel measure values corresponding to these samples.

        Otherwise where disjoint time-series observations were supplied using several calls such as ConditionalMutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariate.addObservations(double[][], double[][], double[][]) then the local values for each disjoint observation set will be appended here to create a single "time-series" return array.

        Specified by:
        computeLocalOfPreviousObservations in interface ConditionalMutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariate
        Returns:
        array of the local values in nats (not bits!)
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if the user had previously supplied covariances directly (ie had not supplied observations).

      • computeSignificance

        public ChiSquareMeasurementDistribution computeSignificance()
                                                     throws java.lang.Exception
        Generate an analytic distribution of what the conditional MI would look like, under a null hypothesis that our variables had no relation (in the context of the conditional value). This is performed without bootstrapping (which is done in computeSignificance(int, int) and computeSignificance(int, int[][])).

        See Section II.E "Statistical significance testing" of the JIDT paper below, and the other papers referenced in AnalyticNullDistributionComputer.computeSignificance() (in particular Geweke), for a description of how this is done for conditional MI. Basically, the null distribution is a chi-square distribution with degrees of freedom equal to the product of the number of variables in each joint variable 1 and 2.

        Specified by:
        computeSignificance in interface AnalyticNullDistributionComputer
        Returns:
        ChiSquareMeasurementDistribution object which describes the proportion of conditional MI scores from the null distribution which have higher or equal conditional MIs to our actual value.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
        See Also:
        "J.T. Lizier, 'JIDT: An information-theoretic toolkit for studying the dynamics of complex systems', 2014."

      • computeSignificance

        protected ChiSquareMeasurementDistribution computeSignificance(boolean skipComputingThisAverage)
                                                        throws java.lang.Exception
        As per computeSignificance() except allows the caller to request that the average is not first computed (if we don't have it already). This is required internally to avoid infinite looping between computeAverage and computeSignificance, when we just want the null distribution and don't need to have the pValue
        Parameters:
        skipComputingThisAverage -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • computeSignificance

        public EmpiricalMeasurementDistribution computeSignificance(int variableToReorder,
                                                   int numPermutationsToCheck)
                                                     throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from interface: ConditionalMutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariate
        Defined as per ConditionalMutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariate.computeSignificance(int) except that this method allows the user to specify which variable is shuffled (whilst the other has its relationship with the conditional preserved).
        Specified by:
        computeSignificance in interface ConditionalMutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariate
        Overrides:
        computeSignificance in class ConditionalMutualInfoMultiVariateCommon
        Parameters:
        variableToReorder - which variable to shuffle: 1 for variable 1, 2 for variable 2.
        numPermutationsToCheck - number of surrogate samples to bootstrap to generate the distribution.
        Returns:
        the distribution of channel measure scores under this null hypothesis.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if user passed in covariance matrix rather than observations
        See Also:
        #computeSignificance(int)}

      • computeSignificance

        public EmpiricalMeasurementDistribution computeSignificance(int variableToReorder,
                                                   int[][] newOrderings)
                                                     throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from class: ConditionalMutualInfoMultiVariateCommon

        As described in ConditionalMutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariate.computeSignificance(int, int[][])

        Here we provide a simple implementation which would be suitable for any child class, though the child class may prefer to make its own implementation to make class-specific optimisations. Child classes must implement Cloneable for this method to be callable for them, and indeed implement the clone() method in a way that protects their structure from alteration by surrogate data being supplied to it.

        Specified by:
        computeSignificance in interface ConditionalMutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariate
        Overrides:
        computeSignificance in class ConditionalMutualInfoMultiVariateCommon
        Parameters:
        variableToReorder - which variable to shuffle: 1 for variable 1, 2 for variable 2.
        newOrderings - a specification of how to shuffle the values of the variable specified by variableToReorder to create the surrogates to generate the distribution with. The first index is the permutation number (i.e. newOrderings.length is the number of surrogate samples we use to bootstrap to generate the distribution here.) Each array newOrderings[i] should be an array of length N (where would be the value returned by ConditionalMutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariate.getNumObservations()), containing a permutation of the values in 0..(N-1).
        Returns:
        the distribution of channel measure scores under this null hypothesis.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if user passed in covariance matrix rather than observations
        See Also:
        #computeSignificance(int[][])} except that this method all

      • getNumObservations

        public int getNumObservations()
                       throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from interface: InfoMeasureCalculatorContinuous
        Get the number of samples to be used for the PDFs here which have been supplied by calls to "setObservations", "addObservations" etc.

        Note that the number of samples may not be equal to the length of time-series supplied (e.g. for transfer entropy, where we need to accumulate a number of samples for the past history of the destination).

        Specified by:
        getNumObservations in interface ConditionalMutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariate
        Specified by:
        getNumObservations in interface InfoMeasureCalculatorContinuous
        Overrides:
        getNumObservations in class ConditionalMutualInfoMultiVariateCommon
        Returns:
        the number of samples to be used for the PDFs
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if the implementing class computes MI without explicit observations (e.g. see ConditionalMutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariateGaussian)

      • computeAverageLocalOfObservations

        public double computeAverageLocalOfObservations(int variableToReorder,
                                       int[] newOrdering)
                                         throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from class: ConditionalMutualInfoMultiVariateCommon

        As described in ConditionalMutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariate.computeAverageLocalOfObservations(int, int[])

        We provide a simple implementation which would be suitable for any child class, though the child class may prefer to make its own implementation to make class-specific optimisations. Child classes must implement Cloneable for this method to be callable for them, and indeed implement the clone() method in a way that protects their structure from alteration by surrogate data being supplied to it.

        Specified by:
        computeAverageLocalOfObservations in interface ConditionalMutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariate
        Overrides:
        computeAverageLocalOfObservations in class ConditionalMutualInfoMultiVariateCommon
        Parameters:
        variableToReorder - which variable to shuffle: 1 for variable 1, 2 for variable 2.
        newOrdering - permutation of the indices for the given variable; must be an array of length N (where would be the value returned by ConditionalMutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariate.getNumObservations()), containing a permutation of the values in 0..(N-1).
        Returns:
        conditional MI under this reordering
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if the user previously supplied covariance directly rather than by setting observations (this means we have no observations to reorder).

      • computeLocalUsingPreviousObservations

        public double[] computeLocalUsingPreviousObservations(double[][] states1,
                                             double[][] states2,
                                             double[][] condStates)
                                               throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from interface: ConditionalMutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariate
        Compute the local conditional MI values for each of the supplied samples in states1, states2 and condStates.

        PDFs are computed using all of the previously supplied observations, but not those in states1, states2 and condStates (unless they were some of the previously supplied samples).

        Specified by:
        computeLocalUsingPreviousObservations in interface ConditionalMutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariate
        Parameters:
        states1 - series of multivariate observations for variable 1 (first index is time or observation index, second is variable number)
        states2 - series of multivariate observations for variable 2 (first index is time or observation index, second is variable number). Length must match states1, and their indices must correspond.
        condStates - series of multivariate observations for the conditional (first index is time or observation index, second is variable number). Length must match states1, and their indices must correspond.
        Returns:
        the series of local conditional MI values in nats (not bits).
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • computeLocalUsingPreviousObservations

        protected double[] computeLocalUsingPreviousObservations(double[][] newVar1Obs,
                                             double[][] newVar2Obs,
                                             double[][] newCondObs,
                                             boolean isPreviousObservations)
                                                  throws java.lang.Exception
        Utility function to implement either computeLocalOfPreviousObservations() or computeLocalUsingPreviousObservations(double[][], double[][], double[][]) depending on value of isPreviousObservations
        Parameters:
        newVar1Obs - provided variable 1 observations
        newVar2Obs - provided variable 2 observations
        newCondObs - provided conditional observations
        isPreviousObservations - whether these are our previous observations - this determines whether we are implementing computeLocalOfPreviousObservations() if true or computeLocalUsingPreviousObservations(double[][], double[][], double[][]) if false. Also indicates whether to set the internal lastAverage field, which is returned by later calls to ConditionalMutualInfoMultiVariateCommon.getLastAverage() (in case of true).
        Returns:
        the local conditional MI values in nats (not bits).
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if means were not defined by #setObservations(double[][], double[][]) etc or #setCovarianceAndMeans(double[][], double[])
        See Also:
        Multivariate normal distribution on Wikipedia,
